snippet: Bobby Petrino, hired as the coach at Western Kentucky, has had his share of troubles, including an affair with an Arkansas staff member. Can coaches get away with anything as long as they win?
abstract: Western Kentucky hires Bobby Petrino, who was fired by Arkansas in April after reports of affair surfanced, as head football coach; Petrino is not the first coach to be offered a second chance; but hiring raises the question whether there is anything coaches cannot get away with so as long as they win.
lead_paragraph: Bobby Petrino, hired as the coach at Western Kentucky, has had his share of troubles, including an affair with an Arkansas staff member. Can coaches get away with anything as long as they win?

headline.seo: Western Kentucky Looks at Future, Not Bobby Petrino’s Checkered Past
headline.main: When a Winning Record Trumps a Checkered Past
headline.print_headline: When Hopes of Future Success Trump Concerns About a Checkered Past
